provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unauthorized Billing
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from causing a consumer's credit or debit card to be charged or bank account to be debited without express authorization, before receipt of product information, before expiration of any free trial, after a cancellation request, or after the consumer is denied the ability to cancel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance with the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
provisions.summary: Defendants are restrained and enjoined from violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, including by inducing consumers to divulge personal financial information through misrepresentations about bank or credit card affiliation or possession of account information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress Payment
provisions.summary: Defendants are jointly and severally liable for $512,000 in redress, satisfied by a $294,000 payment already deposited with the Commission and a $218,000 receivable assigned to the Commission; individual defendants must also provide taxpayer identifying numbers and driver's license copies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Commission's Use of Funds
provisions.summary: Funds paid to the Commission may be deposited into a fund for equitable relief including consumer redress; any remaining funds may be used for other equitable relief reasonably related to Defendants' practices or deposited to the U.S. Treasury as disgorgement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Lifting of the Asset Freeze
provisions.summary: The freeze of Defendants' assets pursuant to the Preliminary Injunction Order entered February 4, 2003 shall be lifted to the extent necessary to turn over assets required by Paragraph V, and upon completion of that transfer shall be permanently vacated and lifted.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Granting of Joint Motion for Entry of Consent Decree
provisions.summary: The Court grants the Joint Motion for Entry of Consent Decree (Dkt. 2) and will separately enter the Consent Decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1692-1692p

provisions.title: Closure of Case
provisions.summary: The Clerk is directed to close the case.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1692-1692p

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendants must pay a civil penalty of $3,500,000 to the United States within seven days of entry of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: If Defendants default on payment obligations, the judgment amount becomes immediately due with interest. Defendants relinquish all rights to assets transferred under this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities as to TeleCheck
provisions.summary: TeleCheck is permanently restrained from violating FCRA sections 611 and 607(b) in connection with its activities as a consumer reporting agency.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities as to TRS
provisions.summary: TRS is permanently restrained from failing to comply with the Furnisher Rule, including by failing to consider the guidelines in 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E, in TRS's written policies and procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit acknowledgments of receipt of this Order and deliver copies to personnel and business entities for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit compliance reports and notices to the Commission at specified intervals and upon certain triggering events.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants must create and retain records for specified periods, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, training materials, dispute files, and compliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through various means including requesting documents, depositions, interviews, and posing as consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Concerning Using or Obtaining Consumer Reports
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from using or obtaining a Consumer Report for any purpose other than a Permissible Purpose.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information (Regulation P), 12 C.F.R. Part 1016; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $120,000 is entered jointly and severally against Defendants, to be paid to the U.S. Treasury within 7 days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information (Regulation P), 12 C.F.R. Part 1016; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all rights to assets transferred under this Order; the Complaint's facts may be used as true in future proceedings; the penalty is not dischargeable in bankruptcy; and Defendants must submit their Taxpayer Identification Numbers to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information (Regulation P), 12 C.F.R. Part 1016; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Prohibitions Concerning Consumer Reports
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from using or obtaining Consumer Reports for purposes other than Permissible Purposes, and must establish procedures to ensure Consumer Reports are resold only for Permissible Purposes, including disclosing end-user identity and purposes to Consumer Reporting Agencies and verifying certifications.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Judgment of $1,500,000 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally, to be paid within 7 days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all rights to assets transferred pursuant to this Order, and acknowledge that the judgment represents a civil penalty not subject to discharge under the Bankruptcy Code.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit acknowledgments of receipt of this Order within 7 days, deliver copies to principals, officers, employees, and agents, and obtain signed acknowledgments from those who receive it.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit timely compliance reports to the Commission, including a 90-day report on Customer Information compliance, a one-year comprehensive compliance report, ongoing notices of changes for 10 years, and bankruptcy notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create and retain specific records for 10 years after entry of the Order, retaining each record for 5 years, including proof of consumer consent, accounting records, personnel records, complaints, compliance documentation, and marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance with this Order through various means, including requesting additional reports, conducting depositions, obtaining discovery, interviewing personnel, and posing as consumers or other entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 604 and 607 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681b and 1681e; Sections 13(b) and 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay $300,000 to the FTC within five days of entry of this Supplemental Order; funds will be used for equitable relief including consumer redress.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Judgment of $40,075.00 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally, suspended upon payment of $3,000.00 within 5 days; funds are to be used for equitable relief, and Defendants must furnish tax identification numbers to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Reopen
provisions.summary: If the Court finds that either Defendant materially misrepresented or omitted assets in their financial statements, the suspended judgment becomes immediately due and payable; Defendants waive the right to contest complaint allegations for purposes of this section.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Notice to Users of Consumer Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide a Notice to Users to any user or prospective user when disseminating a MedPoint medical profile or other consumer report, as required by FCRA Section 607(d).
provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: FCRA Compliance Obligations for Consumer Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain reasonable procedures for limiting report furnishing to permissible purposes, ensuring accuracy, handling disputed accuracy, and complying with consumer report disposal rules in connection with MedPoint or any other consumer report.
provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years documents demonstrating compliance with Parts I and II of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with decision-making responsibilities regarding MedPoint or other consumer reports, and obtain a signed acknowledgment from each.
provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under the order, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting

provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: This order terminates on February 6, 2028, or twenty years from the most recent date a federal court complaint alleging a violation is filed, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681 et seq., and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Provide Notice To Users of Consumer Reports

provisions.title: Reasonable Procedures for Consumer Report Compliance
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain reasonable procedures limiting reports to permissible purposes, ensure maximum accuracy, maintain dispute procedures, conduct reinvestigations of disputed accuracy, and comply with the Disposal of Consumer Report Information and Records Rule.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain documents demonstrating compliance with Parts I and II of the order and make them available to the FTC for inspection upon request for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to all current and future officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with decision-making responsibilities related to IntelliScript or other consumer reports, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on February 6, 2028, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging a violation of the order, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Section 607(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from misrepresenting or assisting others in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication, any material terms of Credit Agreements, including interest rates, payment amounts, interest accrual, repayment periods, and total costs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Monitoring of Dealers and Dealer Complaints
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain written agreements from all Dealers, provide Dealers with accurate financing information, implement a Dealer Complaint handling program, and terminate business relationships with Dealers engaged in patterns of misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Required Disclosures
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide clear, conspicuous, written pre-signing disclosures for Credit Agreements covering identity of creditor, APR, amount financed, finance charges, payment schedule, total payments, security interest information, and potential impact of UCC filings; Defendant must also comply with TILA and Regulation Z.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Prohibited Credit Reporting Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to comply with FCRA requirements for accuracy and integrity of furnished information, reasonable investigation of direct disputes, and duties as a furnisher of information, including ceasing to furnish known inaccurate information, flagging disputed accounts, and blocking information upon receipt of an Identity Theft Report.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: Judgment of $43,605,980 is entered against Defendant, consisting of a $20,000,000 cash payment to the Commission and cessation of collection on at least $23,605,980 in Covered Consumer Debt, with associated credit reporting deletion, UCC fixture filing terminations, refund of received payments, and a compliance declaration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, agrees that Complaint facts may be used in future litigation, acknowledges bankruptcy collateral estoppel effect, consents to use of its taxpayer ID for collecting delinquent amounts, and agrees that received funds may be used for consumer redress or related relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Consumer Notification
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify each consumer with Covered Consumer Debt in both English and Spanish by email and written notice, and then provide the Commission with a signed declaration identifying each notified consumer and notification details.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order to the Commission, deliver copies of the Order to all relevant personnel and Dealers, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt from each.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit an initial annual compliance report, ongoing notices of material changes for 10 years, notices of any bankruptcy filings, and all submissions must be sworn under penalty of perjury and submitted to the specified FTC address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, Dealer Complaint records, compliance records, and copies of all unique marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through written requests for reports and documents, depositions, direct communication with Defendant's employees, and covert means such as posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); and the Duties of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies Rule, 12 C.F.R. § 1022, subpart E

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from making false or misleading statements about her identity or purpose, requesting others to obtain financial customer information unlawfully, disclosing or selling such customer information (with narrow exceptions), and making any materially false or misleading statements.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act Prohibitions
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from violating or assisting others in violating any provision of Section 521 of the GLB Act (Fraudulent Access to Financial Information), as it now exists or may hereafter be amended.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay $2,000.00 to the FTC by certified check or wire transfer within 15 business days of entry of the Order, to be deposited as disgorgement; default triggers statutory interest accrual.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Reopen
provisions.summary: The Order is premised on the truthfulness of Defendant's business records and sworn testimony; if the Commission finds material misrepresentation or omission of revenue, it may move the Court to reopen the Order solely to modify Defendant's monetary liability.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Lifting of Asset Freeze
provisions.summary: The preliminary asset freeze against Defendant shall be lifted upon the Commission's receipt of the monetary relief payment ordered in Part III.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosing Information from Asset Searches
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or otherwise disclosing any identifying or financial information of any person who was the subject of an asset search by Defendant or her agents, except with written consumer consent, to law enforcement, or as required by law.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, in connection with any information-brokering business she owns or controls, Defendant must provide a copy of the Order to all officers, directors, managers, asset-search personnel, and sales personnel and obtain signed acknowledgments, then retain those acknowledgments for three years.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Monitoring Compliance of Employees, Agents and Independent Contractors
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from failing to take reasonable steps to monitor and ensure that all employees, agents, and independent contractors comply with Paragraphs I and II of the Order, in connection with any information-brokering business she owns or controls.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Document Retention
provisions.summary: Defendant must maintain for at least five years all records necessary to demonstrate compliance with this Order and the GLB Act, including financial records, training materials, scripts, and consumer complaints, and make them available to the FTC upon written request.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn written compliance report to the FTC within 60 days of entry; for five years thereafter, must report within 30 days any re-entry into the information brokering business; all notifications must be mailed to the FTC's Division of Financial Practices.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance by all lawful means, including obtaining discovery from any person, using undercover representatives posing as clients or other persons, and using compulsory process under the FTC Act.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Access to Premises, Records, and Persons
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, Defendant must permit Commission representatives, within three business days of written notice, to access business offices, inspect and copy all relevant documents, and interview officers, directors, and employees of any information-brokering business Defendant owns or controls.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Within five business days of receipt of the Order as entered by the Court, Defendant must submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement in the form of Appendix A acknowledging receipt of the Order.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys Fees
provisions.summary: Each party to this Order shall bear its own costs and attorneys fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for all purposes, including construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.company_name: Paula L. Garrett, d/b/a Discreet Data Systems
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Motion to Approve Stipulated Final Judgment
provisions.summary: The United States moves the Court to approve and enter the parties' Stipulated Final Judgment and Order for Civil Penalties, Permanent Injunction, and Other Equitable Relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a); and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x

provisions.title: Prohibition on Improper Prescreened List Practices
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from furnishing prescreened lists without proper verification of permissible purposes, and from furnishing such lists for debt relief or mortgage assistance relief products involving advance fees.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Monetary Payment
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $392,803 to the Federal Trade Commission as disgorgement, to be deposited in the United States Treasury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain business records demonstrating compliance with this order for five years and make them available to the FTC upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Notice of Changes Affecting Compliance
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of this order, and submit additional reports upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on March 5, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comeslater.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations Relating to Financial Products or Services
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from misrepresenting the likelihood that any person will obtain a loan or credit, or the terms and rates available for any loan or extension of credit.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations Relating to All Products or Services
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from misrepresenting consumer authorization, product outcomes, refund/cancellation policies, or any material fact about any product or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A judgment of $4,124,710 is entered in favor of the FTC but suspended based on the accuracy of Defendant's financial disclosures; the suspension may be lifted if material misstatements are found, and all paid funds are used for consumer redress or equitable relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Collection of Advance Fees
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from charging or receiving money for any Credit Repair Service before that service is fully performed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Sale of Tradelines
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from selling or assisting in selling any Credit Repair Service that adds a person as an authorized user to another person's credit account unless that person is given access to such credit.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibitions on Marketing of Credit Repair Services
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from making various misrepresentations in the marketing of Credit Repair Services and from violating CROA disclosure requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Deceptive Business Activities Regarding Any Products or Services
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting the legality, refund policies, or material facts of any product or service, and must clearly disclose refund and cancellation terms.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unsubstantiated Claims
provisions.summary: Defendants must not make any representation about the benefits, performance, or efficacy of any product or service unless they possess and rely upon competent and reliable evidence sufficient to substantiate that the representation is true.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A judgment of $6,630,678 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally; Defendants must pay $64,863 within 7 days of entry, after which the remainder is suspended subject to conditions including accuracy of financial representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendants must provide customer information to the FTC for redress administration upon request, are prohibited from using or disclosing previously obtained customer information, and must destroy such information within 30 days of FTC direction or one year after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry of the Order, and for 20 years must submit sworn compliance notices within 14 days of any material changes; all submissions must be sworn under penalty of perjury and submitted to the FTC by prescribed means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.summary: Defendants must create certain records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, compliance records, and copies of all marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through document requests, depositions, discovery, direct communication with employees, and consumer reporting agency inquiries; Defendants must cooperate within 14 days of written requests.
